project

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is database that stores all of the information of shoppers and administrators.
    Author:
    Kerry

      • registration

        public boolean registration(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String email,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            java.lang.String address,
                            boolean admin)
                     throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException
        This method must register a new shopper user or administrator user. Add the register's email to the emailFile
        Parameters:
        name -
        email -
        password -
        address -
        admin - -> if true, add an administrator user, otherwise add a shopper user
        Returns:
        -> true if registration successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • same_email

        public boolean same_email(java.lang.String email)
        This method must check whether the given email is used before or not. Read the emailFile to determine if it is already inside the file.
        Parameters:
        email -
        Returns:
        -> true if it is same email, false otherwise

      • checkType

        public java.lang.String checkType(java.lang.String email)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method must determine the type(Shopper or Administrator) of the user based on the given email. By accessing the emailFile, the type of the user can be found.
        Parameters:
        email -
        Returns:
        -> The type of the user: Shopper or Administrator
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

        This method must allow the user to log in if the email and password is correct.
        Parameters:
        email -
        password -
        Returns:
        -> The session ID of the logged user, return 0 means failing to log in
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • addCustomer

        public int addCustomer(java.lang.String custName,
                       java.lang.String city,
                       java.lang.String street,
                       int sessionID)
        Adds a new Customer to your application; the customer record that belongs to a newly added shopper user that has no customer record on the system.
        Parameters:
        custName - -> The name of the customer
        city - -> The city of the customer address
        street - -> The street address of the customer
        sessionID - -> A valid sessionID that belongs to an authenticated shopper user.
        Returns:
        -> The added customer ID

      • addProduct

        public int addProduct(java.lang.String prodName,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      java.lang.String image,
                      double quantity,
                      int category,
                      double price,
                      int sessionID)
        Adds a new Product to your application
        Parameters:
        prodName - -> The product name
        category - -> The product category.
        price - -> The product sales price
        sessionID - -> A session ID that belongs to an authenticated administrator
        Returns:
        -> Product ID if successful, -1 otherwise.

      • addDistributionCenter

        public void addDistributionCenter(java.lang.String city,
                                  int sessionID)
        Adds a distribution center to your application. If the given distribution center exists, or sesionID invalid, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        city - -> The city where distribution center must be based.
        sessionID - -> A session ID that belongs to an authenticated administrator

      • addRoute

        public void addRoute(java.lang.String cityA,
                     java.lang.String cityB,
                     int distance,
                     int sessionID)
              throws GraphIsFullException,
                     VertexExistsException
        Adds two nodes cityA, cityB to the shipping graph Adds a route (an edge to the shipping graph) from cityA to cityB with length distance If the nodes or the edge (or both) exist, does nothing
        Parameters:
        cityA -
        cityB -
        distance - -> distance (in km, between cityA and cityB)
        sessionID - -> A session ID that belongs to an authenticated administrator
        Throws:
        GraphIsFullException
        VertexExistsException

      • getDeliveryRoute

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDeliveryRoute(int orderID,
                                                              int sessionID)
        Returns the best (shortest) delivery route for a given order
        Parameters:
        orderID - -> The order ID we want the delivery route
        sessionID - -> A valid sessionID that belongs to an authenticated shopper user.
        Returns:
        -> The actual route as an array list of cities, null if not successful

      • invoiceAmount

        public double invoiceAmount(int orderID,
                            int sessionID)
        Computes the invoice amount for a given order. Please use the fixed price 0.01$/km to compute the shipping cost
        Parameters:
        orderID -
        sessionID - -> A valid sessionID that belongs to an authenticated shopper user.
        Returns:

      • prodInquiry

        public int prodInquiry(int prodID,
                       java.lang.String center)
        Computes the available quantity of prodID in a specific distribution center.
        Parameters:
        prodID -
        center -
        Returns:
        -> Available quantity or -1 if prodID or center does not exist in the database

      • updateQuantity

        public boolean updateQuantity(int prodID,
                              java.lang.String distCentre,
                              int quantity,
                              int sessionID)
        Updates the stock quantity of the product identified by prodID
        Parameters:
        prodID - -> The product ID to be updated
        distCentre - -> Distribution Center (in effect a city name)
        quantity - -> Quantity to add to the existing quantity
        sessionID - -> A session ID that belongs to an authenticated administrator If currently the product 112 has quantity 100 in Toronto, after the statement updateQuantity(112, "Toronto", 51) same product must have quantity 151 in the Toronto distribution center.
        Returns:
        -> true if the operation could be performed, false otherwise.

      • placeOrder

        public int placeOrder(int custID,
                      int prodID,
                      int quantity,
                      int sessionID)
        Attempts an order in behalf of custID for quantity units of the prodID
        Parameters:
        custID - -> The customer ID
        prodID - -> The product ID
        quantity - -> The desired quantity
        sessionID - -> A valid sessionID that belongs to an authenticated shopper user.
        Returns:
        -> The orderID if successful, -1 if not.
